page.title: 02 THE MARKET
page.content: Masham market place is one of the largest in northern England and also one of the quietest. For much of the day it is deserted except for a few parked cars. Markets are held on{Wednesdays}and {Saturdays.}During the summer the number of stalls has steadily increased so that now there are about a dozen stalls on average. People can buy:{vegetables,fruit,plants,health- {foods,linen,home-made cakes,kitchen- {ware,old books,sweets,bric-a-brac, {clothing,materials,cheeses,fish,foot- {wear.} During the winter there are not so many stalls. There is an ancient market cross and the markets date back to a Charter given by Richard II in 1393 to Stephen le Scrope,Lord of the Manor at that time.
